Reviews.Title: Great for me
Reviews.Author: Janice M. Laxton "killing time"
Reviews.Content: I selected this computer for the price.  I am new to Windows 8.0 but I am getting used to it.  This computer does everything that I want a laptop to do.  I am sure there are more expensive models that would do a little more but I do not need aGoliath.  So far it has been great.

Reviews.Title: Not for everyone, but it is for me!
Reviews.Author: pixiedust3
Reviews.Content: I did not like windows 8, until I purchased this computer that is!  I LOVE my new laptop.  I will say it's not for everyone, as it is a bit more fragile feeling than other laptops, but I am not rough on my electronics and if you are not used to windows 8 and/or do not like change, perhaps this isn't for you.  I love the touch screen -  very responsive.  I have had it for four weeks and it seems to be a perfect fit for me!  <3 windows 8 and <3 my new HP Pavilion Touchsmart!

Reviews.Title: May depend on the person!
Reviews.Author: Mom of  2
Reviews.Content: Before this computer I had windows vista, a Gateway computer. Windows 8 is much different that Vista, quite a change but I also had a new windows phone that is very much the same as this so it wasn't hard to adjust, but my husband doesn't  feel the same, to him this it is a huge change. T he laptop itself is great quality, battery lasts a  long time and seems very nice so far. I also love the touch screen but not my hubby, doesn't like the finger prints on the screen. So I would recommend this computer but that may be a personal preference.

Reviews.Title: HP has the best computers
Reviews.Author: Kari Marx
Reviews.Content: Never a problem with any of the 4 HP computers I've owned over the years.  Laptop was gift for daughter and her family and it has everything they wanted.

Reviews.Title: Lovely Hardware, but Windows 8.1 was making me crazy
Reviews.Author: WillieQ
Reviews.Content: If you like the touchscreen interface, this baby gives you a very good hardware package at a very good price.  The transition from Windows XP to this was just too much for me.  Amazon allowed me to return it for a full refund and I replaced it with a Windows 7 laptop.  Imagine my surprise to find that except for the touchscreen interface, 7 is very much like 8.  However, I am much more comfortable with point & click, so I will stay with this one until Microsoft abandons 7.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: Chaz
Reviews.Content: This laptop worked right out of the box and is still working without a hitch.. I would buy another one if I was in need of one

Reviews.Title: HP is still kicking
Reviews.Author: BiBall
Reviews.Content: I have a few complaints about the this computer, but they aren't issues I wouldn't have had with any other PC (e.g. frequent updates, freezing internet browser windows--Windows 8.1 is to blame for that, I'm sure, uploading the newest drivers/compatible programs).  That being said, I really enjoy this machine so far.  I use my computer for a bit of clerical work, lots of internet surfing, social media, copying family videos, photo editing, and for writing.  Can't get used to the fact that there is touchscreen...so I rarely use it.  Sound is decent, picture is great.

Reviews.Title: touchpad drives me nuts
Reviews.Author: CatWoman
Reviews.Content: Don't like bumpy texture of touchpad.  It also seem to drag slower than my finger was moving.  Decided to return & look for another model near same price.
